newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina says British arms embargo "anachronistic".
newsitem.headline: Argentina says British arms embargo "anachronistic".

text.p: Argentina, calling Britain's arms embargo against Argentina "anachronistic," on Monday denied a newspaper report that London had relaxed the ban in return for last year's Falkland Islands oil deal.

Argentina's Foreign Ministry said in a statement the arms embargo did more harm to British industry than to Argentina's navy and that last year's oil deal "was not linked to any objective other than contributing to the economic prosperity of our country."
The statement came only hours after a similar denial by the British government. "The embargo has not been relaxed," a Foreign Office spokesman said in London.
The Observer newspaper reported on Sunday that London had secretly agreed to help re-equip the Argentine navy, despite a ban on arms sales since they fought a 10-week war over the islands in 1982.

Argentina said the embargo was "an anachronistic measure which the United Kingdom maintains. But this conduct harms British manufacturers more than the Argentine Navy, which can get any replacements it needs in other markets."

The Observer said Britain let Rolls Royce Plc open secret negotiations on parts needed to repair the engines of six Argentine warships in return for a deal on oil and gas exploration around the Falklands reached one year ago.

Argentina still claims sovereignty over the remote South Atlantic islands despite defeat in the 1982 war which cost 1,000 lives. Diplomatic links were restored in 1989, putting the issue of sovereignty aside while forging ahead in trade.
But there are still differences over fishing.
